Text: I stayed here from the night of Friday 28th August until Tuesday morning but I was meant to stay for 2 weeks. Glad I didn't! Here are the good points. The room was very spacious and had everything needed including a nice big bed. The bathroom had a proper shower and space for toiletries. There was wifi and breakfast included. Now for the bad, on Sunday and Monday morning I was queuing for breakfast and was told by a member of staff to go to the other side where it said no entry. When I did that another member of staff said the queues over there. Then I tried to explain what I was told by the first member of staff but unfortunately she didn't understand much english. These mixed messages shouldn't happen. I've got no problem with people not being english but if you're going to work in a hotel or similar accommodation you need to know and understand the basics. Also this member of staff that didn't know much english kept staring at me when I was eating. The other bad thing was later on Sunday morning I had gone down to reception to ask about cleaning which I was given a bit of paper about that said I had to choose a 4 hour slot in advance which is fair enough but it failed to mention that cleaning was between 9am and 1pm which I found out from the member of staff who expected me to already know. Then I said can I have the cleaning the next day (Monday) between 9 and 10am and she said no because it has to be 4 hour slot. I said well how am I supposed to choose a 4 hour slot when 9am until 1pm is 4 hours. She then ignored me and spoke to the person behind me who also wanted cleaning done the next day. He asked for an hour slot after 12pm. I waited until he'd gone because it wasn't his fault. It was the staff's fault. I did have a go at the member of staff for ignoring me and for not treating me the same as as the man. I did swear a bit but only out of frustration and not directed at anyone. I then went up to my room and when I came back down to resolve the situation and apologise for swearing the staff member apologised to for not treating me fairly and said my room would be cleaned the next day at the time I wanted. So I then thought everything was fine but Tuesday morning I went to meet with my social worker who told me the hotel staff wanted me to leave even though it had been resolved. This has led me to write this review

Text:
A very cheap budget hotel , not 3star rating at all, the double room is very small with very basic facilities,  eg cupboard , side draws,
Yes it does have a flat screen smart TV and tea/coffee provided with a kettle, No glasses for drinking water.
The private bathroom,  well it has a very small sink , and a equally small shower in it ,
There is a serious lack of onsite parking for guests wanting to stay there,
The plus point in the hotel is that you get good room cleaning service, the cleaning staff member cleans the room good, changes the towels etc and replenishes the shower and soap items , she is very helpful and friendly, the sound proofing is bad, you can hear other guests quite loudly,  the heating facility provided in the room is via a small wall mounted heater and a electric portable radiator....
In all honesty nothing to right home about...
An average place to stay with no frills attached.... more like a place for single people....

Text:
Opinion about Winsor House Restaurant:
Staff of this restaurant is discriminative against the disabled people.

Me and my wife are both disabled (wheelchair-users). We used to like this restaurant.
Food is really tasty and delicious.
The restaurant is physically fully accessible for us but...

There is a problem with some kind of intentional discrimination:

8th October 2020 we have been waiting for 40 minutes to someone who collect our orders 5.30 pm till 6.10 pm (our order was taken after intervention of another customer).

14th October 2020 we have been waiting from 5.30 pm till 7.15  pm. to take our order.

Is it because we are disabled, coming for promotion offer or we do not order a drink?

Tell us the truth, maybe you don't like and welcome such customers as we are?

I will tell many people about my experiences as much people as I can, you will be famous and I'm looking for a lawyer!

Text: Stayed in room 127 from January 29 2020 until February 2, 2020. The receptionist named Mark I believe ( working on February 1st, 2020 around 530pm) threatened to call the police on me, when I simply told him that's not very good hospitality and I'm gonna make sure that I will leave a review. It all started with me and partner coming in with a sandwich from outside and started eating at one of the 20 tables in the lobby area. First off a second receptionists comes to us other thn mark comes to us and rudely advises us that you need to register the car or it will be towed while we had started eating. Upon advising that we have a room here and the car has been registered since day 1, he leaves from our table . The second short heighted receptionist named Mark? Walks and orders us that we immediately take our sandwiches to our rooms. Upon that I advised him that a review will be on the internet. He accuses me that was a threat. Me and family were here for business staying in rooms 127, 131 and 313 all with the same last names and we wont be returning . They are too cheap to even give a 2nd coffee, when we booked with breakfast included. The overall condition of the hotel reflects with the cheapness of the management. To add, they rent to people dependent on council to pay for their housing. Junkies walk around the lobby and the parking lot asking them to buy meals inside or cigarettes. I bought the first 2 meals but soon came to know off the situation. I'm talking about grown fit able men. Also the pictures are very deceiving. Cramped up rooms, tiny washrooms, pungent smell all over and on top of that zero courtesy. Might as well rent the whole hotel to council. We come again next month and it will be premier inn. Hope it doesnt belong to the same management!!

Text:
I have already complained, which has been completely ignored on all levels.
I called and reception said to contact

amer.ashfaq@marriotthotels.com

No response from writing

" I was quite put off from staying again at a Marriott Hotel.
The room was quite 'tired' decor wise - bathroom quite grubby and the curtain actually fell off and landed on me when trying to draw the curtains.
I stay on average 4 hotels a week and this has been one of the poorest value for the price.

I then went to get a meal and waited 10 mins for anyone to actually acknowledge me.
The food (steak and chips) was poor quality - chips undercooked and steak grisly.
Nobody came to check on food so I ended up having to eat what was provided.
I again waited ages to pay, however as the waiter had been more insistent on getting my room number instead of checking the meal was ok I returned to room.

This is absolutely disgusting and harassment.

I then see I have just been charged anyway and have yet to receive any VAT receipt or invoice as requested several times.
I don't even know if I have paid for the parking, however I called down to reception and have it on call recording that writing my reg number on check in paper was sufficient.
I suspect this is not and I will get a ticket.

Sort this out otherwise I will reverse the card payments as unauthorised. I suspect I will not be in a position to leave a favourable review either.
"

Text:
My husband and I enjoyed a lovely massage and spa day here. My masseuse was named Shontelle. She was really lovely, really chatty and her massage was amazing.

The facilities were okay; the steam room was nice but I think it‚Äôs a bit on the older side so there‚Äôs a tad bit of water collection on the ceiling of the steam room and when it drops down it‚Äôs quite hot on skin. Also, the diffusion of steam isn‚Äôt equal - you have to sit right at the top to feel the steam. The sauna was really lovely and up to par. The shower facilities were up to par. The jacuzzi felt a bit cold for the temperature I‚Äôm used to in a jacuzzi, however the size of the jacuzzi is really nice. I did enjoy it regardless of the temperature. The swimming was really nice, 1.2m all the way through. When we were in the pool there was a swimming lesson going on. So there were tons of mothers waiting for their kids and watching us swim etc. It sort of felt like being at the community swimming baths at noon during the summer holidays.

The parking machine took our money and didn‚Äôt give us a ticket. When we spoke to the main reception they said ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs got nothing to do with us‚Äù. When we got to the spa area the receptionist there was more helpful and asked us to sign into the parking machine.

Despite all of this, I would recommend and I would most certainly go back again. We enjoyed ourselves and I‚Äôm sure you will too.

Text:
I did not enjoy my stay, right from check-in I did not have a good experience at all.

When I politely asked if they could keep the noise down... they denied it was even them!

The iron didn't work - at all - so I had to go out with a creased T shirt, and I spent over 30 minutes trying to get hold of ANYBODY at 'guest services', 'room service' & 'reception' to drop a hair dryer in .... to no avail.

Then when I approached reception - to make the complaint in person - I was greeted by another member of staff who seemed more concerned with what was going on on her mobile phone than what I was trying to discuss, and did nothing about the complaint.

I actually stayed at the Manchester Hilton the previous week with no complaints whatsoever.

Wembley Park Hilton is hands down the worst Hilton (perhaps hotel) I've ever stayed at.

Text:
Booked in with the Wembley branch. received a call a few days before my visit saying they had to move me to the West branch (FOR THE SAME RATE) as the wembley branch is using their site for an event. I agreed to move regardless of the inconvenience, I just needed a couple nights alone. The day before my booking I received an email from them telling me that  they have cancelled my booking so all I would need to do is go to the west branch and pay the same rate, and they confirmed that everything is booked and ready.
I called the West branch to confirm this and they confirmed that they did have my booking but for double the price I had already paid and they refused to help me out. I gave up after speaking to 11 staff members for assistance and ended up staying somewhere else.
I would rather pay to sleep on the street on a wet pavement than ever consider booking with the Holiday Inn ever again.
The customer service is so trash. I am surprised the staff I spoke to still have jobs. During this COVID period I can imagine there are people willing to do the job with exceptional service, they should be super grateful rather than arrogant.

Text:
Awesome value for money. I booked this hotel spontaneously during the COVID situation. The staff were so polite and accommodating speaking to them on the phone beforehand. The room was very clean and very comfortable - the bed in our superior room was a mile wide - I collapsed after a long day and had a deep, refreshing sleep. In our home we only have a shower so we took advantage of a lovely bath and enjoyed a long soak.
We have a car and the car parking was fairly priced and very convenient. It is on site and underground - you can drive in, check in then sweep round in to the garage. Do watch out during busy traffic the turn in could be easily missed.
In short - I would highly recommend this place  - enjoy your stay!

Text:
After days of fruitless waiting, I haven‚Äôt received any response in any form from Holiday Inn, Wembley. In this regard, I am now writing a complaint about what I encountered on 1st, Sep. That morning, a cleaner had broken into my room and took away my belongings before I checked out. Among them, four bottles of perfume and some of my personal items such as my notebook were lost. When I came back, seeing this, I soon reported to the reception. 5 minutes later, a lady with glasses came to my room, grasping some of my belongings from a black cleaning bag, and quickly putting them on the table in a panic. I found one bottle of Jo Malone (Red Rose, 100ml) lost, and the packages of all the cosmetics I bought as gifts were broken.

On the grounds that the cleaner could not understand me in English, only mumbling ‚Äúsorry‚Äù, I told the reception that I needed to talk with her manager. After around 10 minutes, a lady came here and apologized to me, while I told her about my loss. Out of sympathy and understanding of how hard life could be in this tough period, I  also promised her I would double check my luggage downstairs to see whether my lost belonging could be in it, and I would forgive the cleaner her intrusion if I could have the perfume back. I then poured all the stuff out of my two suitcases, still not finding my Jo Malone.

I then came to the reception for the third time that morning, asking for an explanation.  At first, the manager tried to convince me that the cleaner just kept my items as ‚Äúlost property‚Äù which the hotel normally keeps 6 moths  for its customer. Listening to her  clarification, I felt a sense of irony and told her I saw the cleaner taking my notebook  for the bag that was also used to contain rubbish. The manager soon apologized and retracted her previous explanation. Finally, she asked me for my phone number, and promised the company would negotiate with me on the compensation.

Today is the fifth day after that intrusion, and I finally realized my forgiveness and understanding could never bring me the the compensation I deserve. So I am currently requesting a written apology and the financial compensation, 98 pounds, which is equal to  the cost of my lost perfume whose transaction record I could provide. The receipt of it was in the bag I lost that day.

Text:
4 nights cut to 1. Tribble sleep and outdated and not cleaned room.

Our bedroom wasn't as advertised on booking.com or even their website.
Matters spring can be felt on right bottom side and top middle left. Really uncomfortable sleep it was for us. Bathroom walls were covered in dust and spiderweb along with mouldings of grouts,toilet seat pan broken completely and doors don't seem to have the slow mechanism to avoid slamming.
We wrote an email to reception and went downstairs to discuss this.  The lady was nice advised she will get the duty manager.  The duty manager rang me as he was busy with breakfast and discussed the issues. He apologized and advised he will see this matter through but I'm the mean time offered to upgrade us to the newly built rooms on higher floor . I was slightly shocked as I thought they were all same standard and makes but different in room size perhaps . Anyway, we said we really didn't want to stay there and wished to be refunded. The manager in all honesty understood the issues we had and refunded the 4 night paid in advance.  Overall,  hotels old rooms definitely needs a lot of tlc and clearly advertised on picture how it looks like, so customers can make an informed decision on whether or not to book.

Text:
Perfectly located to be close to the Excel London with being swamped by it. Transport is easy to use.

My room wasn't as big as a travelodge room but had everything I needed. It was a shower rather than a bath, a smart tv that i could share my laptop to so I wasn't bored in the evenings. Free Wifi is fast and free! In the past other chains force you to pay for wifi that actually is useable.

Only reason for a 4 vs a 5 star was my room was a little dented. There was a visibly fresh repair where the door had bashed the wall and one of my lightbulbs was out.

Overall, for a mid range chain hotel it meets everything you need.

Text: Stayed here for 2 nights as it was close to the excel centre as I was attending Vidcon, and was around ¬£150 than the original hotel I was considering. Was a little skeptical at first as I'd seen mixed reviews however didn't run into any problems personally. Check in was smooth, the room (446) looked like it was newly refurbished with a very nice bathroom, large TV I could stream my phone to and a desk too which was handy when I needed to use my laptop. There was also a safe and electrical heater available which would hear up quickly, aswell as an Aircon. Breakfast wasn't anything gourmet however there was a lot to choose from which is always nice, and considering the price compared to a lot of surrounding hotels, free breakfast is definitely a great addition! Pillows were quite hard however the bed itself was quite comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful which also made the stay better. There was renovation works going on but didn't really cause any problems for my friend and I. Overall, great stay for a cheaper hotel in the London excel area!

Text:
Opinion about Winsor House Restaurant:
Staff of this restaurant is discriminative against the disabled people.

Me and my wife are both disabled (wheelchair-users). We used to like this restaurant.
Food is really tasty and delicious.
The restaurant is physically fully accessible for us but...

There is a problem with some kind of intentional discrimination:

8th October 2020 we have been waiting for 40 minutes to someone who collect our orders 5.30 pm till 6.10 pm (our order was taken after intervention of another customer).

14th October 2020 we have been waiting from 5.30 pm till 7.15  pm. to take our order.

Is it because we are disabled, coming for promotion offer or we do not order a drink?

Tell us the truth, maybe you don't like and welcome such customers as we are?

I will tell many people about my experiences as much people as I can, you will be famous and I'm looking for a lawyer!

Text: London City Airport has a single 4,948 ft long runway and the largest aircraft that can be used at the airport is the Airbus A318 that has been modified with a "steep approach function". The first aircraft landed on 31-May-1987, with the first commercial services operating from 26-October-1987. Text:
Great location )only minutes walk from the Excel centre with car parking and good routes into the city, the hotel was very cosy had many different places to relax in the lobby area including cafe, bar and a restaurant. The breakfast was well worth the money, I had a vegetarian and tried the veg sausages for the first time which was very tasty, the rooms were very clean, ours did not have a water view (it was quiet at night) but from the end of the corridor we could see the marina and planes taking off/ landing at the London airport. The staff were pleasant and we had a good banter with them once we got to know them a little, but the absolutely best thing about our stay (in Feb 2020) was the warm cookies the guys at the reception desk gave us the first night we arrive (also the second night but they had ran out of them on the third night).
Although it was a business trip, these little things made a big impact, so much so that I am writing this review in September 2020 as I sit here ready to book another stay at the Hilton.

Text:
Highly NOT recommended.
If there was an option of minus ratings for customer service, it‚Äôs bottom tier.
For some reason the staff at this property have a bad attitude towards queries and finding resolutions for their customers. After experiencing such awful customer service scrolling through past reviews of this property are 100% accurate on the customer service, attitude from the staff and policies.

Made a booking through Booking.com, it was my first time booking an apartment to stay at, not realising there are age restrictions. Received a call from the property saying I cannot access the property because I‚Äôm not 25, I responded in a calm manner I‚Äôm 24 not a child, there was no need to respond is a rude manner. Text:
Yesterday's matinee was our first visit to the Arcola, to see Maxine Peake's 'Beryl', and we were not disappointed. Though the venue was small, this lively production tells trailblazer Beryl's story with passion and humour. Hard to imagine, if you weren't there, that the cast spent much of their time acting while peddling away frantically on vintage racing bikes. Thoroughly entertaining.
There's also a large bar with plenty of seating that didn't seem too highly priced.
Now we know it's there we will probably return.

Text: I just had my tongue pierced here and had the most fantastic experience. Not only is the shop totally clean, aesthetically pleasing in terms up setup of jewellery, choices, and options (umpteen for anyone who can't decide on just one), private, and well-lit... the staff and their flawless technique are what made this experience totally stellar for me. I have visited plenty of tattoo and piercing shops and have never been treated with such kindness and respect by their phenomenally knowledgeable and professional staff. They made me feel welcome and at home. I discussed my ideas for my helix piercing (I wanted something new and fabulous to replace an old captive bead ring I had had in their for nearly 2 years) with Clem (a guy with a freaking amazing double bridge piercing), and he helped me choose a wicked piece and gave me recommendations and suggestions which I greatly appreciated. I was then escorted to the back area and filled in a consent form. All my questions were answered; I was never rushed or hurried or made to feel like what I wanted to know was silly. I was pierced by Cheryl and this woman is a goddess. She made me feel totally comfortable, welcome, and relaxed. She talked me through the process and swiftly did the piercing without me even noticing... zero pain and I literally couldn't smile big enough because I felt so good. METAL MORPHOSIS, THANK YOU FOR A 11/10 EXPERIENCE AND I WILL SURELY RETURN WHEN I AM BACK IN ENGLAND FOR A NEW PIERCING IN JANUARY! Thank you so much for your professionalism, integrity, patience, and impeccable attention to detail and customer-orientated service... XXX

I was checked-in as soon as I arrived, much to my surprise as I arrived at 9am. My room was clean, spacious and faced a quiet residential street. A king-size bed, large tv, mini-fridge,  an armchair and a large desk. The bathroom was compact but perfect for me as a lone traveller. The bath was a tad narrow and the handrail was a little bit loose so I was wary of using to haul myself out of the tub. I managed to get out of the bath with as much dignity as I could muster.

The room had a powerful air-conditioning which was handy as the weather was scorching hot so coming back to a cool room was heavenly.

The staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly and were highly knowledgable about the local area.

The only problem I encounter was my safe failed to lock. I informed reception and they sent someone to fix it but they couldn‚Äôt so I just left my laptop in my suitcase.

All in all an enjoyable stay.

Text:
The pub itself could use a serious make over but the owners(not the manager) really don't want to spend any money on it which makes the prices sting a bit.
The locals are welcoming and it's just a nice place for a quiet drink. At the weekend they have djs ect. And a large dance floor. There are also pub games like darts and pool. The bar staff helpful and polite and the range of drinks and food on offer are actually refreshingly wide. The manager malik is friendly and accommodating and has a zero tollerence for trouble makers so you can feel safe spending time here. The pub itself is really charming and the beer garden in the rear is huge so big in fact the regulars sometimes have a little kick around with a ball! Also they are a hotel and the rooms are quite nice and very well kept. The prices are fair but the pub itself really needs brightening up and the hack job repairs that have been done are ugly and to my line unacceptable that's the reason for the 3 stars

Text: Found b & b thanks to Booking, but I will try to start from the positive sides: easy booking, we trusted the reviews on the portal in question since there is nothing on Tripadvisor. The house is located about 800 m from the Wood Green subway close to many take away and discount restaurants, we are greeted by the host who explains where the kitchen, the floor, the room is located, where the services are located etc. the downsides. My partner and I look at each other and we immediately understand that the structure has nothing to do with a b & b, rather it looks more like a hostel where rooms are rented. As for breakfast you had to buy the stuff and prepare it in the kitchen (no comment ...), we go up the micro steps that lead us to the upper floor, room with one exposure, nothing to do with the photos seen from Booking, small bed and with short blankets (in addition to the fact that the heating for the first 3 days worked intermittently and was freezing), in the bathroom small tub and without even a socket to dry your hair (the sockets were in the room as if I had to dry myself the hair sitting in bed ...), if the toilet paper ran out it was not replenished (we had to buy it again), absolutely nothing was given, no shower gel, only hand soap and 2 towels that we put to dry because otherwise we would not have had the replacement. As a first experience in London I do not recommend this structure, because it is in all respects a hostel and not a b & b.

Text: Very dated rooms that sadly look far shabbier than those photographed. Bathroom main light did not work, only the vanity light and even that had to be fixed as it was flickering. Parking is available and staff are friendly. There is a small fridge in the room as well as good tea and coffee making facilities. Two proper glasses are also provided. Hand soap and shower soap some as a small bar that would fit into a toddler palm, so bring your own. Shampoo and conditioner is provided. Text: I stayed here from the night of Friday 28th August until Tuesday morning but I was meant to stay for 2 weeks. Glad I didn't! Here are the good points. The room was very spacious and had everything needed including a nice big bed. The bathroom had a proper shower and space for toiletries. There was wifi and breakfast included. Now for the bad, on Sunday and Monday morning I was queuing for breakfast and was told by a member of staff to go to the other side where it said no entry. When I did that another member of staff said the queues over there. Then I tried to explain what I was told by the first member of staff but unfortunately she didn't understand much english. These mixed messages shouldn't happen. I've got no problem with people not being english but if you're going to work in a hotel or similar accommodation you need to know and understand the basics. Also this member of staff that didn't know much english kept staring at me when I was eating. The other bad thing was later on Sunday morning I had gone down to reception to ask about cleaning which I was given a bit of paper about that said I had to choose a 4 hour slot in advance which is fair enough but it failed to mention that cleaning was between 9am and 1pm which I found out from the member of staff who expected me to already know. Then I said can I have the cleaning the next day (Monday) between 9 and 10am and she said no because it has to be 4 hour slot. I said well how am I supposed to choose a 4 hour slot when 9am until 1pm is 4 hours. She then ignored me and spoke to the person behind me who also wanted cleaning done the next day. He asked for an hour slot after 12pm. I waited until he'd gone because it wasn't his fault. It was the staff's fault. I did have a go at the member of staff for ignoring me and for not treating me the same as as the man. I did swear a bit but only out of frustration and not directed at anyone. I then went up to my room and when I came back down to resolve the situation and apologise for swearing the staff member apologised to for not treating me fairly and said my room would be cleaned the next day at the time I wanted. So I then thought everything was fine but Tuesday morning I went to meet with my social worker who told me the hotel staff wanted me to leave even though it had been resolved. This has led me to write this review

Text: Spending a night or two each week away from home, it's good to find a place like this. It's the little things that make a travellers stay memorable. Upon checking in the staff were genuinely friendly, upbeat and couldnt be be more welcoming. The room was spotless and was more than acceptable for the price paid, the bed was better than mine at home. Again, it's the little things. Too many hotels appear to make it as difficult as possible to charge your mobile equipment by rationing the plug sockets!!! I had 4 x double sockets, each with 2 x USB charging points! A great place to stay!! It didn't get 5*s as perfection is impossible. I'll definitely be coming again. Thanks guys.

Text:
A little of the Rona blues..

This a beautiful hotel, set in really nice grounds, the staff are doing an amazing job, they will be the first to admit that things aren't quite what they should be.

But don't let that put you off, the suites are really nice, loads of space and the decor suits the building. There are a few bits that could do with a little work but otherwise it was really nice.

Thanks to Rona there are really less members of staff than there should be for a place this size but then there were nowhere near the guests they could accommodate and so you don't really notice. The waiting staff were the shining light, always happy, always ready to say "that's not a problem."

Thumbs up to a great hotel and let's hope when this is all over we can go back and give it a five!

Cleanliness: Horrible room, very dirty, hairs on bedding, very dusty, dirty toilet seat, awful soap containers.
Maintenance: broken toilet door handle (came out when tried to open the door).
Food: not accommodating to all dietary requirements, horrible taste, too expensive for the quality.
Minibar: not even water bottles or drinking water, 3 biscuits for a family room!
Staff: were understanding and friendly but everyone blamed the other for all these mistakes
Facilities: a very small outdoor pool (which on online pics looked nice and big), one tennis court, and tennis tables (positioned near the pool), so not easy to play when others are in the pool.
Room service: when cleaning the room for our second day stay they removed the travel cot!! I still don‚Äôt understand why! But they were quick in responding to our room service requests
Breakfast: only british breakfast which was good! But yogurt pots for the kids were expired!

Text:
Really well set up for contact-free hiring. Customers are asked to knock on the door at which point an agent will come out. I was served by Diamond who went through all the necessary paperwork quickly and efficiently, invited me to check the car for any pre-existing damage, and got me on the road within minutes. a far cry from all my airport rental experiences where it can take up to half an hour to get everything signed off and ready to go.

On return the same process - the agent came out, inspected the car, and let me know that all the paperwork would be dealt with by email so there was no need to touch anything, sign anything, or indeed make contact with anyone or anything. The staff are all masked and seem to know the proper protocols for everything.

Really great service, would definitely return.

Text:
Spent our wedding night here, staff where excellent!  Staff had decorated our bedroom with rose petals and left us a complimentary bottle of champagne.

The room was stunning with original features on show, wonderful pictures of the hotels historic stories.

Breakfast was amazing and our server was extremely polite.

The room had good amenities with a beautiful bathroom, plenty of plug sockets and a good amount of natural light.

The hotel is situated not far from the busy Uxbridge road, this however was no problem as traffic noise was non existent and extremely good curtains meant we where not disturbed.

WiFi connection was slow but at least useable

Would of preferred a few more sachets of coffee in room as we ran out after our first cup and had to ask for more.

We will definitely be returning again!

Text:
I stayed for one night in between two flights; I chose the hotel for its proximity to T5.

While the hotel itself was gorgeous, and the staff very warm and friendly, I was shocked at some of the incompetence, and basic necessities that lacked during my stay.

The lights in my room did not work properly, and I was surprised that there was no plug next to the bed for charging one's cell phone. The A/C was uncomfortably high, and when I inquired as to whether the hotel had extra blankets I was informed the hotel was full and so they did not. That is absolutely SHOCKING to me for a five star stay. The most troubling part of my stay though is the morning I was meant to leave, I called the reception and concierge for about 15 minutes and nobody picked up the line. I finally ad to go downstairs to request a luggage trolley in person and although there was only one woman being served in front of me (and two staff people) I had to wait an additional ten minutes. This was followed by the elevator not working and me getting stuck in between two floors for ten minutes.

For the price paid I expect more. Finally the room service menu was limited with no fresh or healthy options.

Text:
This was such an easy and stress free  way to visit London. The staff were fantastic. Everyone of them was very friendly, helpful and made us feel welcome during our stay. The breakfast was delicious and had something for everyone. It was very clean and well maintained. Even the staff cleaning the rooms lifted their heads, if you passed in the corridor, to said good morning, or have a nice day.

The only thing negative was that the photo on the site showed a double bed with a single bed at either side of it. However when we got their it was the usual double, single and a pull out bed in between which didn't leave much space to get to the single or double at that side, it was also very hard as a slat was broken.

Overall though we had a fantastic stay and are looking forward to out next visit to London as we will definitely go back to Premier Inn Heathrow M4J4.

Text:
Stayed 30/10
Positives, as a loyalty member we got an upgrade to an executive king room.
Negatives - a booking for my wife and I merited 1 dressing gown, 1 small container of shower gel and 1 little sachet of milk with the tea and coffee!
The restaurants were shut, leaving room service or the option to pick up a tray of food to eat in the lobby! So we went to the hotel next door (Radisson) and had a nice restaurant meal at Steak & Lobster.
Second star is for the bed, which was reasonably comfortable.

Text: I would like to highlight the professionalism of the staff in this hotel, in line with all of the new restrictions that are applied due to the current situation. From checkin to checkout, I was provided a wonderful and warm service. These days, when the service industry has been affected in many ways, including the way the staff are supposed to interact with customers, it is up to the staff to provide that warm welcome that we have been used to in the past, and that is exactly what I felt during my visit to London. I want to thank especially to Marius Draganescu and Claudia, who where extremely kind to me, and helped me with everything I needed to enjoy my stay even more.

Text:
When we think hotel most of us think a place to sleep and recharge for whatever awaits us in our waking time, well let me assure you that in all the hotels, lodges, cottages etc I have stayed in absolutely nothing compares to the quality of sleep I experienced here at Crowne Plaza Hotel! Thank you for that!
The hotel is a little dated in decor but is currently undergoing MAJOR refurbishment which will include every single room in this establishment so be patient and I believe this hotel will be a major contender in the Heathrow area.
The staff here are all very professional and helpful and do what it takes to make your stay as easy and relaxed as can be.
Food is top quality with generous portions and competitively priced for the area.
I look forward to revisiting in time to see the progress with the refurbishment.

Text:
Covid is not an excuse for the food.

Stayed here last night, stayed previously and it was excellent, unfortunately that has changed. Now the hot cookie is gone, and the evening meals and breakfast are not acceptable for a hotel of this standard.

No issues with the room, clean and comfortable like last time. Lady on reception was very friendly, polite and her positive mood is great especially after a long journey.

I would of had a better evening meal if I had gone to the Tesco express across the road, and it would of been a third of the price. I'm no fan of wooden cutlery as you can taste it alot.

Breakfast was very poor, previously one of the best buffet breakfasts I've had in any hotel, to a handful of cereal, a croissant and an apple in a bag. Premier Inn's all you can eat breakfast option is still available, instead of the buffet you just request the items you want. There are many other hotels and restaurants offering quality hot meals and metal cutlery in the evening and also for breakfast. Therefore Covid is no excuse for the current food offerings at this hotel.

I would love to stay again once the food is back to an acceptable standard, however I was highly disappointed with this visit.

Text:
Another of the big rectangular boxes filled with lots of screens. Not much character to the building, but I go to the cinema for the films not the building. Text:
I think the people who rated this low stars had really unrealistic expectations. I mean honestly it's by far the most affordable option in the area. The room has everything you need, it's comfortable, and the staff is lovely. Yes, it's old and outdated. Yes, the room is bland. But the price is amazing and the location is top notch. For five pounds the breakfast is a steal (cereals, juices, tea or coffee, fruit-some fresh, some canned-hard boiled eggs, ham, toast, tomatoes, cucumber, rolls, croissants and cheeses) and there's a certain charm to this small, old building (the ratio of staircase height and tall ceilings make no sense, we're in room 206 but on the third? Floor). If for any reason I needed to be in the area again, I'd stay here in a heartbeat. It's a posh spot surrounded by shops bars And restaurants and two minute walk to the river.

Seriously, what do the poor reviewers expect? Do you realize how expensive the London area is? Do you have any idea what 83 bucks a night will get you elsewhere? Be reasonable. It's not the Ritz. You're also not paying for the Ritz. I'm happy. The only reason I gave 4 over 5 stars is because the reception leaves at ten, which I find worrisome, and they didn't have enough exterior keys to go around.

Text:
An institution. The kind of perennial neighbourhood place that has ceased to surprise you but consistently delivers on the high expectations it set when it once did.

The bar is magnificent, worth going to just to be in, big, bright, open and full of big tables. If you‚Äôre eating try and get a table in the restaurant section at the back. If you‚Äôre catching the late summer evening light, get a table outside. There‚Äôll randomly be a box of surplus apples or kiwis or something by the front door for people to take home. There are board games.

The food is very, very good. I have ceased to be surprised, as I said, but the quality of the ingredients is so good (particularly the vegetables which I presume come from the farm associated with the restaurant) that I am regularly delighted. The fact that it‚Äôs organic doesn‚Äôt excite my ethics enough to see past what is sometimes a relatively pedestrian menu, but it‚Äôs clear that that leaning on good ingredients is what gives The Duke it‚Äôs theme, and what makes it so reliable.

I don‚Äôt drink the wine (but I assume it‚Äôs great), the whiskey menu is good (but I don‚Äôt drink whiskey). The beer selection is very acceptable,there is always something excellent to drink. The fact that not all the beers on sale are organic probably says something about organic beer (...does anyone care if their beer is organic?), and there are often some wasted taps given to dull options that fit with the theme of the restaurant. But they always have something very good on tap and normally have bottles of Kernel in the fridge.

I love this pub. It is the residential neighbourhood corner bar/cafe/restaurant that the city you fantasise about living in has, but it‚Äôs in the city you‚Äôre in.

Text:
One of the most beautiful pubs in London with the best tasting food.
This place has it all, but I think I was sold by the beautiful interior and 17th century fireplace which had a fire going. Nice seating, friendly staff and beautiful decorations made for a great experience.
The Sunday roast was what I had come for though so let's talk about that. I am extremely critical of a roast so I don't take these things lightly.
We had the chicken roast and the beef roasts with a side of the cauliflower cheese. Starting with that, this cauliflower cheese was one of the best I've ever had with a mix of cheeses I couldn't put my finger on. Creamy, cheesy and delicious with the cauliflower cut up nice and small to maximize cheese!.
The roasts were a thing of perfection, with the star strangely being the gravy. Normally a second thought but here each dish had its own type and they were so good. The tender chicken and well cooked beef meant everything was great. Along with them came roast potatoes, which had been seasoned! Can't tell you how shocked I am to find so many places serving up plain potatoes.
There were also roasted carrots. They were sliced long and charred, something totally new to me and I was sold.
Along with some kale, parsnips and massive Yorkshire puddings, we left very stuffed and very happy!
Also, get some cocktails, they were great!

Text:
I was staying here for 4 nights for a mini holiday. The hotel is in a good location, 3 minutes walk from Gloucester Road Tube station and 15 minutes walk from Earl‚Äôs Court and South Kensington Tube stations.

I was checked-in as soon as I arrived, much to my surprise as I arrived at 9am. My room was clean, spacious and faced a quiet residential street. A king-size bed, large tv, mini-fridge,  an armchair and a large desk. The bathroom was compact but perfect for me as a lone traveller. The bath was a tad narrow and the handrail was a little bit loose so I was wary of using to haul myself out of the tub. I managed to get out of the bath with as much dignity as I could muster.

The room had a powerful air-conditioning which was handy as the weather was scorching hot so coming back to a cool room was heavenly.

The staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly and were highly knowledgable about the local area.

Text:
I had the privledge of experiencing the magic that happens within Broadway Lodge in March 2014. After experiencing a long miserable hopeless battle in active addiction for many years of never being able to free myself of the misery that my life had become. Thankfully I received the opartunity to be admitted to Broadway and the first thing that struck me was the love and compassion that I felt from every single staff member this was something I had never exsperienced whilst being in active addiction and put me at ease and allowed me to fully embrace what Broadway had to other without fear of being judged. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Broadway I turnt up with a total inability to take responabilty in any area of my life no matter how basic it was. I was inspired and instilled with hope for the first time in my life thanks to the staff and program of brroadway Lodge. I will be forever grateful today I live a totally abstinent life style I have a amazing life I take resoncability in every area of my life I'm a devoted loving father son brother uncle I manage a business today just knowing people have faith and trust in me to allow me these opartunities is one of the most rewarding feelings I have exsperienced. Today I'm a long way from the person that turned up in 2014 a hopeless junkie that could never ever stop using no matter how painful what prison sentence how many tears my family members shed at watching me deteriate and live that existence of being a hopeless junkie. Text:
This hotel *could* be a great budget place to stay!
OYO in Camberwell is just one bus away from Central London and is easy to find. The rooms were clean and had everything you would need.

Unfortunately, there were scuff marks and a few stains on the wall which put a bit of a downer on the room. Also breakfast is really strange... They had a lovely selection of teas, coffees and continental. However, there is no meat as part of the full English (lots of egg, beans, mushrooms and tomato though).

In summary it is good value for money if you need a place to stay and don't plan to stay in much.

Text: I went here to get my wheels aligned. I paid 79 pounds and got told that it's done, shown a screen something I didn't understand and walked away. Within 3,4 days I realised that my steering wheel still pulled. I took my car to a specialist wheel alignment shop. They charged me 60 pounds, showed me that two of my wheels, one rear and one front were still misaligned. Fixed them for me, gave me a printes result receipt (got none from kwik fit) and my car has been great ever since. I paid 80 pounds for nothing done with kwik fit. Somewhere along the way I also went there for them to check my clutch and they told me the bearing was coming off and they would need to take the gear box off. I then took it to the official dealership and a different garage and they both told me it's the clutch natural free play and nothing to worry about. If that's not a rip off I don't know what is. I don't recommend this garage by any means.

Text:
Perfectly located to be close to the Excel London with being swamped by it. Transport is easy to use.

My room wasn't as big as a travelodge room but had everything I needed. It was a shower rather than a bath, a smart tv that i could share my laptop to so I wasn't bored in the evenings. Free Wifi is fast and free! In the past other chains force you to pay for wifi that actually is useable.

Only reason for a 4 vs a 5 star was my room was a little dented. There was a visibly fresh repair where the door had bashed the wall and one of my lightbulbs was out.

Overall, for a mid range chain hotel it meets everything you need.

Text: Stayed here for 2 nights as it was close to the excel centre as I was attending Vidcon, and was around ¬£150 than the original hotel I was considering. Was a little skeptical at first as I'd seen mixed reviews however didn't run into any problems personally. Check in was smooth, the room (446) looked like it was newly refurbished with a very nice bathroom, large TV I could stream my phone to and a desk too which was handy when I needed to use my laptop. There was also a safe and electrical heater available which would hear up quickly, aswell as an Aircon. Breakfast wasn't anything gourmet however there was a lot to choose from which is always nice, and considering the price compared to a lot of surrounding hotels, free breakfast is definitely a great addition! Pillows were quite hard however the bed itself was quite comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful which also made the stay better. There was renovation works going on but didn't really cause any problems for my friend and I. Overall, great stay for a cheaper hotel in the London excel area!

Text:
Opinion about Winsor House Restaurant:
Staff of this restaurant is discriminative against the disabled people.

Me and my wife are both disabled (wheelchair-users). We used to like this restaurant.
Food is really tasty and delicious.
The restaurant is physically fully accessible for us but...

There is a problem with some kind of intentional discrimination:

8th October 2020 we have been waiting for 40 minutes to someone who collect our orders 5.30 pm till 6.10 pm (our order was taken after intervention of another customer).

14th October 2020 we have been waiting from 5.30 pm till 7.15  pm. to take our order.

Is it because we are disabled, coming for promotion offer or we do not order a drink?

Tell us the truth, maybe you don't like and welcome such customers as we are?

I will tell many people about my experiences as much people as I can, you will be famous and I'm looking for a lawyer!

Text: London City Airport has a single 4,948 ft long runway and the largest aircraft that can be used at the airport is the Airbus A318 that has been modified with a "steep approach function". The first aircraft landed on 31-May-1987, with the first commercial services operating from 26-October-1987. Due to the airport's proximity to Central London, it has stringent rules imposed to limit the noise impact from aircraft operations.

Text:
Great location )only minutes walk from the Excel centre with car parking and good routes into the city, the hotel was very cosy had many different places to relax in the lobby area including cafe, bar and a restaurant. The breakfast was well worth the money, I had a vegetarian and tried the veg sausages for the first time which was very tasty, the rooms were very clean, ours did not have a water view (it was quiet at night) but from the end of the corridor we could see the marina and planes taking off/ landing at the London airport. The staff were pleasant and we had a good banter with them once we got to know them a little, but the absolutely best thing about our stay (in Feb 2020) was the warm cookies the guys at the reception desk gave us the first night we arrive (also the second night but they had ran out of them on the third night).
Although it was a business trip, these little things made a big impact, so much so that I am writing this review in September 2020 as I sit here ready to book another stay at the Hilton.

Text: Stayed in room 127 from January 29 2020 until February 2, 2020. The receptionist named Mark I believe ( working on February 1st, 2020 around 530pm) threatened to call the police on me, when I simply told him that's not very good hospitality and I'm gonna make sure that I will leave a review. It all started with me and partner coming in with a sandwich from outside and started eating at one of the 20 tables in the lobby area. First off a second receptionists comes to us other thn mark comes to us and rudely advises us that you need to register the car or it will be towed while we had started eating. Upon advising that we have a room here and the car has been registered since day 1, he leaves from our table . The second short heighted receptionist named Mark? Walks and orders us that we immediately take our sandwiches to our rooms. Upon that I advised him that a review will be on the internet. He accuses me that was a threat. Me and family were here for business staying in rooms 127, 131 and 313 all with the same last names and we wont be returning . They are too cheap to even give a 2nd coffee, when we booked with breakfast included. The overall condition of the hotel reflects with the cheapness of the management. To add, they rent to people dependent on council to pay for their housing. Junkies walk around the lobby and the parking lot asking them to buy meals inside or cigarettes. I bought the first 2 meals but soon came to know off the situation. I'm talking about grown fit able men. Also the pictures are very deceiving. Cramped up rooms, tiny washrooms, pungent smell all over and on top of that zero courtesy. Might as well rent the whole hotel to council. We come again next month and it will be premier inn. Hope it doesnt belong to the same management!!

Text:
We have been staying several Premier Inns. Probably Richmond one was a little dissappointment. The location was a little far away from anything. It is closer to East Sheen station rather than Richmond centre.
You can go to Sainsbury's ( which is a good size one with some clothes) on foot within 5 mins but the way to get there is a little awkward, go around a roundabout and narrow path. To get to Richmond Park, again a little awkward, you need to walk about 20 mins to get to a main gate. There is a narrow path leads to Bog Gate through East Sheen common next to a cemetery entrance, but it is VERY difficult to find and unless we asked a local lady, we never knew the shortcut to get into the park. The park is huge but the gate is not that many.
Apart from Sainsbury's, there is not that much places to get food unless you walk back to Richmond station ( 10mins walk).
Also the traffic is very noisy if you stay a room facing the main road. We did not, but then the people staying near our room was very noisy all night. The door of the rooms seems to be very thin and I can hear sound much more than any other Premier inns I stayed before.
Breakfast was ok but the seating was clamped and not very nice.
We like Richmond Park a lot but not sure of this hotel...

Text: We loved this hotel and our stay there. Staff are super friendly and very helpful. The only reason I haven't given it 5 stars is because we ordered a medium wine with a beer, twice. The 2nd time, the bill was higher. When we questioned it we were told we had been given a large wine, even though we hadn't ordered it. The barman insisted we paid the higher price even though the error wasn't ours. This was corrected later on in the evening by a different barman who gave us a large wine and only charged for a medium, after he heard what had happened. Not enough of an issue to stop us having a great stay, and we have booked again for later on in the year. Great location, fantastic bed and a breakfast that was well worth the wait.

Text:
I think the people who rated this low stars had really unrealistic expectations. I mean honestly it's by far the most affordable option in the area. The room has everything you need, it's comfortable, and the staff is lovely. Yes, it's old and outdated. Yes, the room is bland. But the price is amazing and the location is top notch. For five pounds the breakfast is a steal (cereals, juices, tea or coffee, fruit-some fresh, some canned-hard boiled eggs, ham, toast, tomatoes, cucumber, rolls, croissants and cheeses) and there's a certain charm to this small, old building (the ratio of staircase height and tall ceilings make no sense, we're in room 206 but on the third? Floor). If for any reason I needed to be in the area again, I'd stay here in a heartbeat. It's a posh spot surrounded by shops bars And restaurants and two minute walk to the river.

Seriously, what do the poor reviewers expect? Do you realize how expensive the London area is? Do you have any idea what 83 bucks a night will get you elsewhere? Be reasonable. It's not the Ritz. You're also not paying for the Ritz. I'm happy. The only reason I gave 4 over 5 stars is because the reception leaves at ten, which I find worrisome, and they didn't have enough exterior keys to go around.

Text:
We booked a last minute getaway and had such a great 2 night stay at Warren House. The room was just lovely and the grounds stunning.
All the staff were attentive and hardworking with particularly excellent service and rapport coming from Ivor & Daniela who made our stay even more enjoyable!!
Food was excellent!! Enjoyed every meal.
First day breakfast service was great! Second day breakfast service seemed a little unorganised, lacking in communication and being served by 3 different staff members as well as different meals continuing to arrive at our table throughout. Would benefit from set sections but understand it was busy and potentially the busiest it‚Äôs been since opening under new management 1 month ago.
Would also be good to be notified of Gym & Pool closures on booking or arrival rather than after enquiring. BT sport was not available even though advertised in brochure.
But overall had a really lovely stay and would definitely recommend Warren House to others.
Thank you so much üòä

Text: We had afternoon tea at Warren House. Based at Kingston, this doesn't feel like we are in the suburbs of London. This sprawling Victoria House is tucked away from the hustle-bustle of London in ab oasis of calm. We were really pleased with the courteous and attentive staff. Experience was quintessentially British with delicate sandwiches and beautifully crafted desserts. Decor was beautiful and we also strolled through the sprawling beautifully manicured grounds. The restaurant is excellent as well and Sunday roast is highly recommended.

Text:
Avoid at all cost!

An absolutely awful experience with their lettings department.  No customer care for tenants - a tenancy agreement is more like a blackmail agreement at the end of lease. Mis-sold on NDO (no deposit option). Demands and threats of legal action made on exit costs which were not substantiated by the landlord (or by a property check document, which was not even carried out in the presence of tenants) and no support on negotiations thereafter to agree a fair and reasonable recharge.  Charged for costs which should never have been incurred at the end of lease. Attempts by landlord made to reclaim costs for items which remained within the property at end of lease - had to do Leaders job to inform them where the alleged "missing items" were.  "Negotiations" were dealt with by tenants 3 page letter of evidence and reasoning behind disputed costs just being forwarded to landlord, who refuted costs without reasoning and tenants told "landlords do not need to give reasons behind their decision".  I could go on, but have wasted enough of my time trying to dispute costs, which fell on deaf ears.  Resulted in a payment being made out of despair - and then still got threatened with legal action for alleged non payment.
A wholly unprofessional unethical "service".

Text:
This hotel is beautiful on the inside and out. In a convenient location for the metro and a ten minute walk from a host of nice restaurants on the front of a dock! A shout out to Salento Restaurant a ten minute walk away. Definitely worth eating out here if you stay.

My only indifference with this hotel was on the first night I witnessed a man get refused at the bar for having too many (in reality he had had five which I believe is the hotel's maximum) but the woman behind the bar came across as very prejudiced against alcohol which didn't sit well with me.

The rooms were amazing on the upside! The shower is one of the best I've been in and the beds got their job done too. The TV was a good size too with plenty of storage space.

Breakfast was all you can eat which can't go wrong! I think it was ¬£7 per head which is tremendous in my opinion for what you get.

Text:
We had a great stay, overall, at the Hilton London Canary Wharf. The room we booked was large and, for the most part, clean and tidy. I have removed a couple of stars because as other reviewers have also said, we had a small, suspicious looking yellow stain on the crisp white duvet cover and there were small black marks on the fresh pillow cases so perhaps they need to examine housekeeping and laundry practices more thoroughly? There were also bits of dirt and fluff and a small feather in the corner of the room which implies they are not vacuuming all parts of the room thoroughly enough (so much for extra safety protocols in the midst of a pandemic!).

On the positive side, we were allowed an early check (and on departure, a late checkout) in which was greatly appreciated and it was quiet in the hotel for most of our stay. There was no room service menu available due to the pandemic but they did bring a mini breakfast upto our room inside brown carrier bags and some coffee in takeaway plastic cups. Housekeeping was on a request-only basis due to the pandemic but that was fine with us. The bathrooms are very clean and tidy, albeit a bit small but that is London for you generally. If you are a tall person and have to raise the showerhead higher, it tends to splash over the shower screen into the toilet area which is not the most hygienic situation.

Staff are very friendly, as i said they offered us both an early check-in and a late checkout and were hospitable and professional.

The location is fantastic with plenty of eateries around although not all are open due to the pandemic and if you use the footbridge at the back of the hotel, you literally end up in the middle of Canary Wharf so the hotel is situated rather perfectly. Although the hotel is on a main (and usually busy) road and almost directly opposite a DLR station in the financial capital of London, we heard no noise, except for the odd door banging from neighbouring guests. We enjoyed staying at this hotel, apart from the few cleanliness issues, and as Hilton Honors Members, we shall return here again soon.

Text: Nice set of apartments set right next to Canary Wharf. Each apartment has different amenities. Some have an oven some don't. This room was nice had microwave, dishwasher, double electric hob, pots, plates,  glasses and a fridge.  Tea and coffee were also provided as well as a kettle. My room had a partition between the living area and the bedroom. Both have their own tv, and there is a music dock and DVD player in the living area too.  In the bedroom there is an ample sized wardrobe which hides a washing machine. In the cabinet by the bed was the safe. The bathroom has a heated towel rail and wall long mirror. The shower is huge, I'm lead to believe that some rooms have baths. There is also a panel heater in the front room that warms the place very nicely, I have issues with hotels and cold and the heating not getting hot enough. No issues here. I was here during covid so no socialization and there were cleaning continuously and there were many hand sanitizer about. Masks are a must and the staff are polite and helpful.  Some rooms also have a balcony window or full balcony. I believe the parking is ¬£7 per night (I didn't have to pay so price may vary)  but that cheap for where it is and is secured and o ly accessible by your room key card. Look forward to going  again. Will try for a bath in the room next time as that would have topped it for me.

Text: Superb museum - one of the best in London. Very well set out over two floors. Extremely informative and visually very appealing. Docklands is a fascinating area and has undergone so many different metamorphoses. This museum depicts each of these different periods in an exciting and often moving way. A real London highlight!

Text: Today's visit was to see the 'Havering Hoard' - a big bronze age collection of artifacts and ingots excavated near the Thames in Essex in 2018. Archaeologists have deduced much about how people lived here about 5,000 years ago, this knowledge is skillfully shared in a way accessible to adults and children. The museum has a large permanent collection, including one of the UK's best exhibitions on the Slave Trade, a major contributor to London's wealth from the 17th to early 19th centuries.  We are only now starting to acknowledge slavery's pervasive legacy. Well worth a visit.

Text: Really really difficult to find by address alone or even with Google maps. I circled the square around the tube exit several times before coming to the conclusion that th signage was extremely subtle. The number 10 is on a singular stone tablet outside and there's no name above the door, only above the reception desk inside. To be fair you could see it through th glass frontage and spin doors if you looked hard enough. The interior is sleek, marbled, modern and very spacious. Modern art pieces adorn the atrium beyond the entry turnstiles. I was here for a large Carers UK conference. Our lecture theatre was well equipped, though our hosts seemed to struggle a little with operating the P.A. system. The view to the gardens from our atrium food service space was lovely, relaxing and you might forget you're in the heart of big business when you're admiring the trees and shrubs.

Text:
I went for  the Vietnamese, Tuesday night 50% off food.

The people behind the bar who took the food order were brilliant. Service was excellent, The IPA beer was great.
However I did not enjoy the food as much as the previous time.

The calamari rings were too thin so it was difficult to taste the calamari inside. Its a shame as it appears corners have been cut to offset the discount.

The other starter,  Green papaya asked was fresh but  lacked flavour due to the absence of herbs and spices.

The fried chicken burger was good. The chips accompanying the burger  were too oily and not great.

The vegetarian jackfruit burger did not  taste of jackfruit and felt more like the bean burgers you used to get 10 years ago. The patty was not that flavoursome and was oily.
Again the chips accompanying this burger was not good.

Not sure if the chef has changed. I felt it was cooked by someone without  an expert understanding of vietnanese herbs and spices.  Maybe something the owners need to address. I used to do take aways from their home in midland Road  b4 they joined the pub  a couple of months back. Sadly the standard of the food had declined.
I am not being mean  just comparing it to the standard of food I eat often at the Kingsland Road Vietnamese restaurants.

3. The didn't give me back the fascia from the original Sony stereo.
4. The stole all the screws and accessories from the original Sony Stereo as well.
5. I've got a botched Alpine radio and I can't reinstall the original Sony stereo owing to all the accessories being missing.
6. I paid for the privilege of this messed up installation.

Avoid at all costs

Text:
Great cheap and cheerful hotel that's a good price for the location. Situated just by the river there are plenty of places to eat and drink and it's easy to get into central London.

The room felt clean and the whole place had reassuring COVID measures in place. The bed was very comfortable too (you might want to ask for extra pillows) and the Aircon worked - what else do you need when you just need a base to explore the city? The hotel is a little tired overall but let's face it, nobody should expect luxury at a Premier Inn.

The parking is quite expensive but considering how convenient it is it was worth it for us as we'd driven.

Text:
Three of us stayed here last weekend. The hotel may be rated 3* due to facilities, however, in terms of service, it's first class. From the reception staff to the room cleaners and floor and back-kitchen staff, it is easy to see that the staff have been hand-picked and trained.

Perfectly comfortable beds, buffet of British and/or Continental breakfast, clean clean clean. I had an evening beverage here with a significant member of the Hilton Group, "absolutely fine", was her comment.

Declan,
Dublin, Ireland.

Text: The hotel was great, clean rooms, good breakfast everything up to the Holiday Inn standards. What really annoyed me was the attitude from the front desk person. Talking with her I noticed from her accent that she was from Spain so I started speaking in Spanish - which is my native language. Outrageously, this person kept switching back to English in a very disrespectful way. By the way, her English was not great either. Why in the world you want to have multilingual staff if they don't even serve the purpose to make guests comfortable? I really felt terrible, discriminated and not welcomed. I had the impression that this person had some kind of inferiority complex speaking with me in a language we both share. This industry is called hospitality for a reason. I liked the hotel, the amenities but as far as making me feel welcomed, I give it zero stars.

The coffee was a bit disappointing since it's instant from a machine. If you leave early you can get a breakfast package. When we arrived we saw that someone ordered food from the hotels menu and asked about it but the staff more or less instantly recommended us to order from McDonald's on the opposite side of the road. Parking is offered and is great for those who travel with car.

Text:
This is an amazing place to stay. The quality of the room and the facilities available are amazing. Unfortunately, as we stayed during the pandemic we were unable to visit the spa although I‚Äôve been told the spa is just amazing as the rest of the hotel.

There are added extras in the room. The tea and coffee making facilities are I believe the best in the area. Small things like the smart TV and automatic lights in the wardrobe make you feel as though you‚Äôre staying in central London! I understand that I only stayed in one of their basic rooms so I can‚Äôt wait to see what the more expensive rooms have in store!

The restaurant has something for everyone. I had the garlic prawns as a starter which were absolutely amazing. I even had to ask for more bread to soak up all of the sauce because it tasted so good! My partner had the duck spring rolls which were amazing. I then had the biryani as a main course and my partner had the pasta. The biryani is honestly one the best biryani I‚Äôve ever had.
Overall, it was great to be able to eat different cuisines in one place and have each cuisine executed so well.
The cocktails were strong and sweet - made very well.

The owner of both the hotel and the restaurant is a very welcoming and lovely man. The waiters In the restaurant were very welcoming and accommodating as where the reception staff within the hotel.

I will 100% be staying at this facility and also eating in the restaurant again!

Text:
I have never stayed somewhere and made to feel as neglected as I have felt staying at DoubleTree Hilton. I am completely unhappy with the service and I will in no way shape or form be returning.

If you are not a Diamond customer apparently you are not valued. There are different levels of service depending on how they view you.

There is no consistency in the service and. Communication is practically nonexistent (minus the small irrelevant and meaningless chit chat they like to make).

The heater all of a sudden went out and is now only blowing cold air. The temperature of the shower is just about warm with no way to increase the heat.

There are some exceptions for example Vincenzo the front house staff member is exceptional but, that is my only positive note.

I came here after staying with another hotel and I now live with that regret. I do not like to bash organizations but, my experience will hopefully help others.

I can also confirm that the shower area is small and cold.

Text:
Upon arrival, we were greeted by Isabelle at reception who was an absolute delight! She was very knowledgeable about the hotel and was very warm and welcoming!
We went up to our room and had to call down to reception to ask if we could move, as the room we had been given was accessible and did not suit our needs very well.
Isabelle happily changed rooms for us which was great.
The next day breakfast was very nice and had a great selection.

The reason for my 3 stars is because I had probably one of the worst nights sleep ever! The pillows were very soft, and the mattress was not very good. I woke up the next morning with terrible back pain which has not yet subsided. I have never had trouble with my back, however after one night of sleep at this hotel, I am in constant pain. Unfortunately I was not asked how my stay was on check out, so felt rather awkward bringing it up having not been asked.

I appreciate that firmness of pillows and mattresses are all personal preference, however leaving a hotel with severe back pain is not what one expects after a night in a hotel. Reading the other reviews here, I may just be an unlucky guest; however I could not fault the rest of my stay.

Text:
Avoid booking and paying ‚Äúdeposits‚Äù.

Instead I found the next business day a payment of ¬£50 taken out of my account.
It has now been 13 days (10 working days) and still no refund. Looks like not much is done either despite email communication.

Plenty of other pubs around the area to book: Perky Nel, Avalon, Devonshire and The Grove.

UPDATE: It is now week 3 and yet still not refund. Nothing being done via email escalation either. So looks like the ¬£50 'deposit' won't be returned anytime soon. Despite the '3 to 5 business days' as claimed in their policy.

Text:
Initial impression; the man on reception was blunt. The hotel corridors smelt musty and linen was scattered on the floor as rooms were being serviced. Our room had dirty walls and there was a broken tile in the bathroom which stood up slightly, posing a potential health and  safety risk. The cupboard had a broken top hinge, so the door didn't close properly. Worst of all, one of the staff let himself into our room while we were there, without knocking. He claimed to be looking for a bag that had allegedly been left behind. We said there was no bag and he said "if you find it, please tell reception"...in a small room which had just been serviced! Really?
We had booked three nights, but we stayed thirty minutes.
The hotel still took our money and have not responded to any of our correspondence since
Not recommended at all. Do not stay there. Would have given zero stars if I could have.

Text:
I stayed with my family last friday night for 2 nights.

The second night was offered at a 50% discount due to bad unacceptable service.

I have instructed a legal firm now to act for me after an employee of the hotel valet parked my car and severely damaged it.

The general manager adam lake should not be representing this hotel as he is very unprofessional and ignorant not what you would expect from a mayfair hotel.

I felt that I was dealing with a 2 star hotel at best and felt very uncomfortable speaking to him  after he eventually decided to speak to me.

He was very rude and aggressive and told me either I listen to him or If I engage a law firm all correspondence will end.

Myself and my family are in complete shock over what has happened.

The staff wore  medical masks which was startling and on the first night when we asked for balsamic vinegar the waiter came back with a bottle of malt vinegar saying he has been to a shop and this is all he could get.

The manager said in his own words after I told him I would certainly leave an adverse review ‚ÄòI look forward to it.

There is an undesirable undertone to this as advertised  so called luxury hotel.

Please do not be fooled by the false facade and welcome  by the staff on arrival.

We have stayed at many 5 star hotels around the world and this hotel is quite frankly a joke.

Text: I went to the UK for my Babymoon in 2016 and stayed at the Corinthia for several days. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The service was top notch. Being from the United States, I was charmed by the level of service. The hotel staff clearly value their guests. The room was lovely, but compact. I enjoyed the TV in the bathroom and heated towel rack. The turndown service at night was a special treat. The complimentary tea service was great too. The Corinthia is located near a Tube station and within walking distance to many attractions. Even being 8 months pregnant, I was able to walk to the London Eye, the Palace of Westminster, and Buckingham Palace.
